commit_message:
Update Nova config parameter in image guide

According to [0], '[DEFAULT] scheduler_default_filters' has been deprecated in
favor of '[filter_scheduler] enabled_filters'.

[0]
https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/config-reference/tables/conf-changes/nova.html

Change-Id: I38116272540023b4fe0da9f872ec959e4a42a1c6

commit_message:
Drop py34 target in tox.ini

We support py35 now.so it is no need to keep
the supoort for py34.

Change-Id: I6cceec5b8e5d3e65a85e4d11d1494fe37ac3a42c

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ifc4fc2f2b6202d3ac8564a0964a3df3527056e3e

[{'created': '2017-11-23 02:22:15.000000000', 'message': "Handle exception in get_instance_sorted when gather cells' results.

Currently, when we get servers list in multi cell, we scatter gather results
from cells. But if we get back exception or timeout from cell, we will get
500 error finally.

This patch try to fix it, we just skip the timeout or other exceptions.

Change-Id: I4d9319a3ae82547bb3e6952ee44f0a3e98ab9a50
Closes-Bug: 1734012

commit_message:
Handle gathering exception in get_instance_sorted.

Currently, if we get servers list in multi cells, we will
scatter gather results from cells. But if we get back
exception or timeout from cell, we will get 500 error finally.

This patch try to fix it, we just skip the timeout or other
exceptions.

Change-Id: I4d9319a3ae82547bb3e6952ee44f0a3e98ab9a50
Closes-Bug: #1734012

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ia195f3b0667fdab613e15fa8d04b25635a2568c2

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Fix AttributeError of dell emc driver

initiator_check is defined as a type of bool,
but is used as a str type.

Change-Id: Ib01deaa222c2ee2d16256bf2e8540af782f5dbf8
Closes-Bug: #1736661

Support policy.yaml file [part 7]

- Vitrage
- Watcher
- Zun

This will copy only yaml or json policy file if they exist.

Co-authored-By: Duong Ha-Quang <duonghq@vn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Try to remove unnesessary apt installation for newer docker image

The change is from TODO in the plugin.sh. We're using ubuntu 16.04
docker image so that we can remove them in default.

Change-Id: I6df6f61ec38e91e3dc0ae76053e1aa8a008b11f7

commit_message:
Disable the wsme Sphinx extension from the API ref docs

This causes the following error:

    while setting up extension wsmeext.sphinxext: directive 'autoattribute' is
    already registered, it will be overridden

commit_message:
Relex schema to allow 'source' as optional

For 'mounts' parameter, users can specify either 'source' or 'size'.
However, in json schema, 'source' is required so users have to
do something like {'source': '', 'size': '1', ...}. This is not
ideal. This patch improve the jsonschema to allow 'source' to be
missing.

Change-Id: Idf4747ab1e52f987db7d5695b9fda9054ce8aecf

subject: Add cpu_mode in vagrant/bootstrap.sh
messages: [{'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2018-01-24 02:30:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26553, 'date': '2018-01-24 06:44:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-01-24 08:04:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11869, 'date': '2018-01-29 05:08:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 02:30:58.000000000', 'message': 'Add cpu_mode in vagrant/bootstrap.sh

With libvirt 2.0, when using qemu cpu mode is not properly
evaluated and need to be set to cpu_mode = none.

Add this option when kvm is not supported, otherwise user
will still facing errors when launching instances over qemu.

Change-Id: I7aa6df356085263d25c6afcc812f035d3ded942b
'}]
commit_message:
Add cpu_mode in vagrant/bootstrap.sh

With libvirt 2.0, when using qemu cpu mode is not properly
evaluated and need to be set to cpu_mode = none.

Add this option when kvm is not supported, otherwise user
will still facing errors when launching instances over qemu.

Change-Id: I7aa6df356085263d25c6afcc812f035d3ded942b

subject: Add support for Fedora 27, remove EOL Fedora 25
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16690, 'name': 'Noam Angel', 'email': 'noama@nvidia.com', 'username': 'noama'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25405, 'name': 'Tim Flink', 'email': 'tflink@fedoraproject.org', 'username': 'tflink'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 25405, 'date': '2018-01-23 10:49:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-01-23 10:49:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2018-01-23 11:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

if we leave support only for fedora 26 and 27, I think it will be a good change to get rid of old fixes and workarounds for older release for example https://github.com/openstack/diskimage-builder/blob/master/diskimage_builder/elements/fedora/package-installs.yaml'}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2018-01-23 11:37:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25405, 'date': '2018-01-23 11:52:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> if we leave support only for fedora 26 and 27, I think it will be a
 > good change to get rid of old fixes and workarounds for older
 > release for example https://github.com/openstack/diskimage-builder/blob/master/diskimage_builder/elements/fedora/package-installs.yaml

I'm not against the idea of getting rid of older cruft but it's been years since Fedora 21 was supported. Shouldn't that cleanup be a change in itself instead of being grouped together with a smaller change that is effectively changing a few constants?"}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2018-01-23 12:18:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

> > if we leave support only for fedora 26 and 27, I think it will be
 > a
 > > good change to get rid of old fixes and workarounds for older
 > > release for example https://github.com/openstack/diskimage-builder/blob/master/diskimage_builder/elements/fedora/package-installs.yaml
 > 
 > I'm not against the idea of getting rid of older cruft but it's
 > been years since Fedora 21 was supported. Shouldn't that cleanup be
 > a change in itself instead of being grouped together with a smaller
 > change that is effectively changing a few constants?

I just wanted to point it out, if any of the core want to take action about that..
I have update the default release to 27 and the user guide to reflect your change"}, {'account_id': 25405, 'date': '2018-01-23 12:24:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Looking at that PPC CI failure, I would assert that it's a test problem - it fails on installing dmidecode which is supposed to be skipped on ppc64. The problem comes in that the test is supposed to install lshw for ppc64 and ppc64el but in Fedora, ppc64el is ppc64le and I suspect this is causing the attempted install of dmidecode.

I'm unclear on whether I should update the test as part of this change or not."}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2018-01-23 13:21:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Looking at that PPC CI failure, I would assert that it's a test
 > problem - it fails on installing dmidecode which is supposed to be
 > skipped on ppc64. The problem comes in that the test is supposed to
 > install lshw for ppc64 and ppc64el but in Fedora, ppc64el is
 > ppc64le and I suspect this is causing the attempted install of
 > dmidecode.
 > 
 > I'm unclear on whether I should update the test as part of this
 > change or not.

it will be kind of you.. but its a non-voting job and not related to this commit"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-23 14:16:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25405, 'date': '2018-01-23 14:35:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > Looking at that PPC CI failure, I would assert that it's a test
 > > problem - it fails on installing dmidecode which is supposed to
 > be
 > > skipped on ppc64. The problem comes in that the test is supposed
 > to
 > > install lshw for ppc64 and ppc64el but in Fedora, ppc64el is
 > > ppc64le and I suspect this is causing the attempted install of
 > > dmidecode.
 > >
 > > I'm unclear on whether I should update the test as part of this
 > > change or not.
 > 
 > it will be kind of you.. but its a non-voting job and not related
 > to this commit

I've filed https://bugs.launchpad.net/diskimage-builder/+bug/1744944 and am working on a fix"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-29 04:32:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

OK; but I really wonder about the future of the "fedora" target?

Is it being used for anything?  Given the overall person-power available for it, I feel like we're better off just focusing on fedora-minimal?

While it's just bumping version numbers I guess it's not a big deal; but if it becomes a lot of invasive changes for something we're not sure is actively being used, we may have to reconsider  

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-August/121585.html'}]

commit_message:
Add support for Fedora 27, remove EOL Fedora 25

This updates diskimage-builder to support current Fedora releases (26
and 27) and removes support for Fedora 25 which is EOL as of December
12, 2017.

Change-Id: I227a607c6c468cc8b7bb154a189e9c8ce2021192

subject: Don't install dmidecode on Fedora ppc64le
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 16690, 'name': 'Noam Angel', 'email': 'noama@nvidia.com', 'username': 'noama'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25405, 'name': 'Tim Flink', 'email': 'tflink@fedoraproject.org', 'username': 'tflink'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 25405, 'date': '2018-01-23 14:54:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2018-01-23 15:04:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25405, 'date': '2018-01-23 16:11:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The ppc64le test for fedora is still failing but this failure is different - it looks like https://github.com/python-greenlet/greenlet/issues/119 which maybe an issue with gcc 7

Also, the merge conflict with the lshw installation review would be easy to fix - it'd be a matter of which patch is merged first"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-01-28 22:11:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> The ppc64le test for fedora is still failing but this failure is
 > different - it looks like https://github.com/python-greenlet/greenlet/issues/119
 > which maybe an issue with gcc 7
 > 
 > Also, the merge conflict with the lshw installation review would be
 > easy to fix - it'd be a matter of which patch is merged first

That change you mention has +W so I'd say it'll get there first ;p"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-01-28 22:18:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Looks good to me.

The whole ppc64le vs ppc64e thing is a bit of an annoyance.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-28 23:54:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-01-28 23:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Looks good to me.

and clean rebase due to merge conflict'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-01-28 23:57:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For the record based on a  quick grep this is the only package-installs file that lists ppc64el and not ppc64le so we should be good now ;P'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-29 00:00:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I think we all agree it kind of sucks putting this everywhere.

The root problem seems to be that we should probably have ARCH=ppc64 and then figure out in the code where we know what distro we're installing if we need "le" or "el" in various places.

But that's all sorts of refactoring and potential to break what people have.  

---

another option is to just hack this in diskimage_builder/elements/package-installs/bin/package-installs-squash to just match ppc64 ...'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-01-29 00:26:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I think we all agree it kind of sucks putting this everywhere.
 > 
 > The root problem seems to be that we should probably have
 > ARCH=ppc64 and then figure out in the code where we know what
 > distro we're installing if we need "le" or "el" in various places.
 > 
 > But that's all sorts of refactoring and potential to break what
 > people have.
 > 
 > ---
 > 
 > another option is to just hack this in diskimage_builder/elements/package-installs/bin/package-installs-squash
 > to just match ppc64 ...

That probably works, the wart is that ppc64 is the same CPU running in Big-Endian mode and typically has quite a different package set.

But given that this is currently the only instance of this issue it'd work there ;P'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-29 04:27:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow+1

if tonyb is happy, i'm happy :)"}]

commit_message:
Don't install dmidecode on Fedora ppc64le

While Debian-based distros use the label of ppc64el for ppc64 little
endian, Fedora uses ppc64le.

The ironic-agent was doing arch specific package install of lshw over
dmidecode for ppc64 and ppc64el but was attempting to install dmidecode
on Fedora ppc64le which caused the test to fail due to a missing
package.

This change just adds ppc64le to the arch-specific package installation
description for the ironic-agent element.

Change-Id: I38c3c1480bbbb2df817856614e6b740a0c02723a
Closes-Bug: 1744944

hi, Kien Nguyen, the zuul still fail for this patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508023/. Is there something missing?'}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2017-10-09 08:33:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

> hi, Kien Nguyen, the zuul still fail for this patch
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508023/. Is there something
 > missing?

Hi Shunli,

Zuul failed due to legacy-zun-devstack-dsvm-docker-sql failure. This is a legacy job. These jobs will be completely removed when [1] & [2] patches landed. One of them is already landed. At that time, the problem will be solved.

Zuul -1 will be treated as 3rd party CI, therefore it won't affect to merge process. The patch could be merged even Zuulv3 -1.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509969/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509970/"}, {'account_id': 8264, 'date': '2017-10-09 09:08:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Thanks Kien Nguyen for the reply. ：-）'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-29 05:21:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/pike as commit 7b538e04917e385dc6a52d9073ff81df3dc33c61'}]

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Fix 'volume_type' for in the api-ref

1 The 'volume_type' shoud be required in the rest_method of request.
  So fix the request paremeter about volume_type
2 Fix  the parameters of 'volume_type' in the volumes-v3-volumes.inc

Change-Id: I585db62579ac134885a49dc020508a9f0fba3c78

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 15:19:56.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: don't attempt to live snapshot paused instances

When we changed the default value of the
workarounds.disable_libvirt_livesnapshot config option value
to False in 980d0fcd75c2b15ccb0af857a9848031919c6c7d earlier
in Queens, we were testing against the Pike UCA packages which
has libvirt 3.6.0 and qemu 2.10. Live snapshots of a paused
instance work with those package versions as shown by the
test_create_image_from_paused_server test in Tempest.

However, if you just use the Ubuntu 16.04 packages for libvirt
(1.3.1) and qemu (2.5), that test fails and the live snapshot hangs
on the paused instance.

This change adds PAUSED to a list of power states that aren't
valid for live snapshot. We can eventually remove this when we
require (or add a conditional check for) libvirt>=3.6.0 and
qemu>=2.10.

Change-Id: If6c4dd6890ad6e2d00b186c6a9aa85f507b354e0
Closes-Bug: #1741667
"}, {'created': '2018-01-18 17:05:19.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: don't attempt to live snapshot paused instances

However, if you just use the Ubuntu 16.04 packages for libvirt
(1.3.1) and qemu (2.5), that test fails and the live snapshot hangs
on the paused instance.

This change adds PAUSED to a list of power states that aren't
valid for live snapshot. We can eventually remove this when we
require (or add a conditional check for) libvirt>=3.6.0 and
qemu>=2.10.

Change-Id: If6c4dd6890ad6e2d00b186c6a9aa85f507b354e0
Closes-Bug: #1741667
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: don't attempt to live snapshot paused instances

When we changed the default value of the
workarounds.disable_libvirt_livesnapshot config option value
to False in 980d0fcd75c2b15ccb0af857a9848031919c6c7d earlier
in Queens, we were testing against the Pike UCA packages which
has libvirt 3.6.0 and qemu 2.10. Live snapshots of a paused
instance work with those package versions as shown by the
test_create_image_from_paused_server test in Tempest.

However, if you just use the Ubuntu 16.04 packages for libvirt
(1.3.1) and qemu (2.5), that test fails and the live snapshot hangs
on the paused instance.

This change adds PAUSED to a list of power states that aren't
valid for live snapshot. We can eventually remove this when we
require (or add a conditional check for) libvirt>=3.6.0 and
qemu>=2.10.

Change-Id: If6c4dd6890ad6e2d00b186c6a9aa85f507b354e0
Closes-Bug: #1741667

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I3591f07fe5321389399729f3f77cef72d00cdbfc

The Elasticsearch image tag was updated to accomodate the kernel
versions used in the gate as part of the kernel update playbook
See https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/issues/28349#issuecomment-360233779

The openstack-exporter binary was changed to reflect changes made
to the openstack-exporter image

Change-Id: I1deb9e7cde794421dd33fade566c2a9fdb5007e6
'}]
commit_message:
Gate fix: httpd image, elasticsearch, openstack-exporter

There was a change in the upstream reference httpd image for
apache that changed how modules were built for apache.
This change adds the required fix to accomodate the change.
See isssue here https://github.com/docker-library/httpd/pull/87

The Elasticsearch image tag was updated to accomodate the kernel
versions used in the gate as part of the kernel update playbook
See https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/issues/28349#issuecomment-360233779

The openstack-exporter binary was changed to reflect changes made
to the openstack-exporter image

Change-Id: I1deb9e7cde794421dd33fade566c2a9fdb5007e6

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I382d428b204de1820d446571259d62e3a3f660ed

subject: floatingip related should be removed from compute client
messages:
[{'account_id': 22056, 'date': '2018-01-18 15:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22056, 'date': '2018-01-18 15:49:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2018-01-18 17:23:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

we need to take a closer look at this for backwards compatibility. current openstackclient still works with very old installs of openstack. cc dtroyer'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-01-18 22:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Why just floating IP and not the rest of the compute support for networking?

It may be a long time before this actually is able to be removed, we still support very old clouds (kilo is in production in many places still).'}, {'account_id': 22056, 'date': '2018-01-19 03:38:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks for your information.I just use openstackclient with latest novaclient and find that floatingip related api has been removed from novaclient, it will raise error. Other networking apis haven't been removed. How should we be better to deal with this situation?"}, {'account_id': 17386, 'date': '2018-01-23 16:58:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Any change here should have a release note so users know what the alternative is. If this is removed, what is the new (or already existing) command to add a floating ip to an instance?'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-01-23 17:51:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

novaclient has a very different use case and deprecation policy than OSC.  The only real relationship OSC has with novaclient is we use it as a Python API for most of Compute.  It no longer supports all of the APIs that OSC needs to continue to support (such as the floating IPs) so we had to re-implement that in OSC directly.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-24 08:48:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

In the OSC maintenance policy, the latest OSC tries to cover older clouds like Kilo. This is difference from novaclient. In case of novaclient, novaclient queens release mainly supports nova queens release. In case of OSC, OSC queens release supports older releases of OpenStack, so we cannot drop these codes.'}, {'account_id': 22056, 'date': '2018-01-29 02:40:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

OK, I got it, thanks. So, I will abandon this patch.'}, {'account_id': 22056, 'date': '2018-01-29 02:41:12.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

won't fix"}]

into his existing patch.

Change-Id: I45a20324bb42ae79ea850097622476b4f1c357dd
'}]
commit_message:
Doc follow up: expirer using general task queue

This is just a follow up patch to cover documenting the
legecy processes and process options.

Also a drive by adding the object-expirer configuration
to the deployment_guide.

As discussed with Kazuhiro, this will simply be squashed
into his existing patch.

Change-Id: I45a20324bb42ae79ea850097622476b4f1c357dd

commit_message:
Doc: split second-node setup out of quickstart guide

The quickstart guide is for new developers to quickly setup the
environment and they are unlike to setup additional nodes
as part of the quick start. So let's split the multi-node setup
session out.

Change-Id: I83f7aa61ec0c2681a5b9e79950ebde27879ca961

commit_message:
RBD: get manageable volumes

This patch adds the ability to get manageable volumes to RBD driver.

Co-Authored-By: qtlu<qtlu@fiberhome.com>
Partial-Implements: blueprint list-manage-existing
Change-Id: I0621358b13fc3f5a4acfb8d66232fb953d94b274

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-25 17:04:51.000000000', 'message': "Use the 'ironic' queue for the gate

When doing the 'gate' build have the ironic-lib jobs be part of the
'ironic' queue. More information on this is in [1]. The benefit of
this is that we are only impacted by ironic projects if we do this.

From [1]:
Pipelines which use the dependent pipeline manager maintain separate
queues for groups of projects. When Zuul serializes a set of changes
which represent future potential project states, it must know about
all of the projects within Zuul which may have an effect on the
outcome of the jobs it runs. If project A uses project B as a library,
then Zuul must be told about that relationship so that it knows to
serialize changes to A and B together, so that it does not merge a
change to B while it is testing a change to A.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/zuul/feature/zuulv3/user/config.html

Change-Id: I8d99ef25b83ca05534a6392b83406fe76ce5cf5b
"}]
commit_message:
Use the 'ironic' queue for the gate

When doing the 'gate' build have the ironic-lib jobs be part of the
'ironic' queue. More information on this is in [1]. The benefit of
this is that we are only impacted by ironic projects if we do this.

From [1]:
Pipelines which use the dependent pipeline manager maintain separate
queues for groups of projects. When Zuul serializes a set of changes
which represent future potential project states, it must know about
all of the projects within Zuul which may have an effect on the
outcome of the jobs it runs. If project A uses project B as a library,
then Zuul must be told about that relationship so that it knows to
serialize changes to A and B together, so that it does not merge a
change to B while it is testing a change to A.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/zuul/feature/zuulv3/user/config.html

Change-Id: I8d99ef25b83ca05534a6392b83406fe76ce5cf5b

Hi Jeremy, 

thanks for the patch.

Just two remarks:

- Can you add a warning or deprecation section in the documentation to highlight the change between ocata and pike ?

- Is it possible to show the warning log only when using the old name ? from looking at the code, it seems to be printed all the time'}, {'account_id': 21797, 'date': '2017-07-11 01:05:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Hi Jeremy,
 > 
 > thanks for the patch.
 > 
 > Just two remarks:
 > 
 > - Can you add a warning or deprecation section in the documentation
 > to highlight the change between ocata and pike ?
 > 
 > - Is it possible to show the warning log only when using the old
 > name ? from looking at the code, it seems to be printed all the
 > time


Hi Maxime,

At first, I also wanted to show warnings only when old section names are used, but had no idea how to handle like that. Because these deprecated sections need to be registered before being used.

I guess it's not a good idea that we register two sections(old and new) and calling deprecation for the old one.

If you have any suggestion on how to handle, please let me know. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 21797, 'date': '2017-07-11 01:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-11 02:48:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified+1

commit_message:
Keep consistency across configuration section names

Mark 'keystone_fetcher' 'ceilometer_collector' 'gnocchi_collector' as
deprecated. To keep consistency, the section names should have the
following format: {backendtype}{backend_name}

Story: 2001053
Task: 4654
Change-Id: I5013837fb0c260eafd81a469e5261982fd17dc77

Can you please provide a commit message ?

And also why target newton ?'}, {'account_id': 21797, 'date': '2017-01-10 14:44:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sorry, huats. This bug was first found in Newton release, but also exists in master branch. We can backport it to stable/newton branch now since it's already fixed in master branch.
I did not update the commit message because I thought it's better we just follow the original commit."}, {'account_id': 2376, 'date': '2017-01-10 20:42:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

OK I understand what you mean. So in that case it is better to cherrypick that fix to Newton. And not address it like this. Let's focus on Ocata for Now, and during the freeze let's have a look at the Newton cherrypick... But PLease keep somewhere to fix that one..."}, {'account_id': 21797, 'date': '2017-01-11 02:57:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> OK I understand what you mean. So in that case it is better to
 > cherrypick that fix to Newton. And not address it like this. Let's

 > the Newton cherrypick... But PLease keep somewhere to fix that
 > one...


Indeed, this commit is cherry-picked from master.
I agree with you that we focus on Ocata for now and do the cherry-pick job during the freeze time."}, {'account_id': 21797, 'date': '2017-02-21 14:08:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Use diff_cover tool in coverage test

This test will fail if the changed lines of a PR are not 100% covered [1].

[1] http://diff-cover.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

commit_message:
Unify exceptions

Currently, we have cloudkittyclient/apiclient/exceptions.py that has
defined exceptions. So, we should reuse those instead of redefine them
in exc.py. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I1e766815804b2848da973225bd02917d28807eac

commit_message:
Rename exc.py to exception.py

In most openstack projects, we use a full name exception.py.
This patch takes the convention for Cloudkittyclient.

Change-Id: I3469496270a5c5c3f3edf2d0db3f0af0f32d258d

commit_message:
Add 'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv

Running py2* post py3* tests results in error. Add
'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv to
resolve this.

Closes-Bug: #1565928
Change-Id: I111d82a1509af03aa2e141ee3fd9b2ff9e223215

commit_message:
Replace curly quotes with straight quotes

Curly quotes usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Change-Id: I726ec59a4425708c653674cb3b24aa6690ad9fe3

commit_message:
fix vol-type test case error

The return value of get_volume_types only contains two item,
when get_volume_types_2 return a item which index is 2, it will
raise exception of range out of index.

Change-Id: I4ceb64f0d1379f82d6304aeac23bc219c6170a6a

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I820c9462836bb3c6830d4c2246505482c0c4c455

commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: I6cc40b4fc473df29c6e3d7844fde6340694d43bb
Partial-Bug: #1741634

commit_message:
Remove architecture rules on lshw dependency in ironic-agent

There's a patch in flight in ironic-python-agent to switch the
default hardware manager to use lshw instead of dmidecode. [0]
This would require lshw to be installed regardless of
architecture. This patch removes the architecture rules from
lshw in the package-installs list.

[0] Ie370331df6bb5ef131c5cb60f458877e2a7ad71a

Change-Id: Idaf05b8efce28cd0cbf339cf693db4f55a693d9b
Partial-Bug: #1715790

messages: [{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-28 15:58:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-28 16:48:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-28 17:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-28 21:08:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-28 15:58:47.000000000', 'message': "Don't run legacy-tempest-dsvm-cells on newton/ocata/pike

For some reason, the cellsv1 job has been failing at a very
high rate within the last couple of weeks but only on stable
branches; libvirt connections have been dropped causing test
failures. This isn't a problem on master, for whatever reason -
maybe something different in pike UCA packages used on master
for queens, it's not known right now.

We also have changes that we have to merge into stable related
to zuulv3 job definitions to unblock some things on master, so
for now we're going to not run the cellsv1 job on stable branches
until the bug is sorted out, or we redefine the job and make it
non-voting on stable.

Change-Id: Iaed05d569199375ab2db874951aa17b435704295
Related-Bug: #1745838
"}]
commit_message:
Don't run legacy-tempest-dsvm-cells on newton/ocata/pike

For some reason, the cellsv1 job has been failing at a very
high rate within the last couple of weeks but only on stable
branches; libvirt connections have been dropped causing test
failures. This isn't a problem on master, for whatever reason -
maybe something different in pike UCA packages used on master
for queens, it's not known right now.

We also have changes that we have to merge into stable related
to zuulv3 job definitions to unblock some things on master, so
for now we're going to not run the cellsv1 job on stable branches
until the bug is sorted out, or we redefine the job and make it
non-voting on stable.

Change-Id: Iaed05d569199375ab2db874951aa17b435704295
Related-Bug: #1745838

commit_message:
Prepare transitional DOA package

It was suggested to create a new major version (which will be 4.0.0)
of DOA as a transitional package to stop providing any module itself.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126431.html

Queens release of horizon is planned to depend on the new DOA release.

Part of blueprint merge-openstack-auth
Change-Id: I3776fedcf21c1b4d669fede478f58518d489f0ef

commit_message:
split multinode playbook

Separate quickstart multinode playbooks into smaller
playbooks that follow the same breakpoints as the libvirt playbook in
tripleo-quickstart-extras.

This is part of the preparations to convert CI to follow the step by
step workflow the users will follow to reproduce CI

Change-Id: I6fdde6eaebae4a624234e67d9d6e195f0092fc78

By luck, :inherited-members: does what we want because the base ResourceManager's methods do not have docstrings. On the offchance that more docstrings show up in the future, we should be more careful with doc generation.

But for now, this is fine. Let's push this ahead to get the release in."}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-01-26 19:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-01-28 17:34:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-26 18:05:16.000000000', 'message': 'Auto-document members properly

Supporting APIv2 in saharaclient meant that there is now some fancier
inheritance going on, so Sphinx :members: now misses a bunch of
user-facing methods. Now, start using :inherited-members: to get what
we want.

Additionally, put the v2 docs under the main reference section instead
of in their own section.

Change-Id: I56067fe54332497f8d0962986383b74a27d84a76
Closes-Bug: #1745650
'}]
commit_message:
Auto-document members properly

Supporting APIv2 in saharaclient meant that there is now some fancier
inheritance going on, so Sphinx :members: now misses a bunch of
user-facing methods. Now, start using :inherited-members: to get what
we want.

Additionally, put the v2 docs under the main reference section instead
of in their own section.

Change-Id: I56067fe54332497f8d0962986383b74a27d84a76
Closes-Bug: #1745650

(11 comments)

Please my in-line comments. Also, I suggest adding 2 more test cases:

1) test_show_multi_segment_network. The steps are:
   - Create a network with _create_routed_network
   - Show the network. You are going to get something like: http://paste.openstack.org/show/566174/. Please note that the network has attributes 'provider:network_type', 'provider:physical_network', 'provider:segmentation_id'
   - Make assertions based on what you got in the previous step
   - Add a segment to the network
   - Show the network again. You are going to get something like: http://paste.openstack.org/show/566175/. Note that now, the network has an attribute 'segments', which is a list with the provider attributes for each segment
   - Make assertions based on what you got in the previous step

2) test_create_segments_different_types
   - Create a network with _create_routed_network
   - Add a segment of type 'vxlan' without specifying physical network or segmentation id
    - Show the network
    - Assert the network has a segment of type 'vlan' and one of type 'vxlan'"}, {'account_id': 20277, 'date': '2016-09-07 21:10:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 20277, 'date': '2016-09-07 21:12:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

We need your expert guidance to move forward. Please see in-line comment'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2016-09-20 22:36:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

I think we need to add another test case, test_ip_allocation. It will test a new port attribute, ip_allocation. If you create an unbound port in a routed network, the port will not have fixed ips and the value in ip_allocation will be 'deferred'. This is because since the port is not bound to a host, Neutron cannot pick the segment and subnet to allocate the fixed ip from. See an example here: http://paste.openstack.org/show/582332/. Please also note that in the binding information, binding:host_id is null and binding:vif_type is 'unbound'.

When you bind the port to a host, it gets a fixed ip and ip_allocation becomes 'immediate'. binding:host_id now has 'allinone' and binding_vif_type is 'ovs'. This is an example of a bound port: http://paste.openstack.org/show/582334/

The steps to test this would be:

1) Create a port on the routed network
2) Assert the the port got no fixed ips and that ip_allocation is deferred. Also assert that the binding information is as described above
3) Bind the port. You accomplish with a port update, where you update the binding:host_id attribute with the name of the host where the port should be bound. A CLI example of this is: 

neutron port-update --binding:host_id=allinone <port-id>

An example of doing this in code is here: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_segment.py#L1139

4) Assert the port now has a fixed ip and ip_allocation becomes 'immediate'. Also verify the the binding information is as described above"}, {'account_id': 20277, 'date': '2016-09-23 22:27:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(1 comment)

Thanks Miguel for the suggestion and help. New test case is added'}, {'account_id': 20277, 'date': '2016-09-23 22:27:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2016-09-23 22:36:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

Add api tempest tests for segments

This patch adds Tempest API tests for the segments service plug-in

Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
Add policy check for complete attachment API action

Add new policy rule for complete_attachment action to
prevent anyone who can read the attachment from the database
to complete it (mark it as in-use)

Change-Id: Idad8c44acde155e70f6f9f618887a97fc956cdd2
Closes-Bug: #1737000

commit_message:
Fix api-ref for v3 volume types

This patch is mainly to remove some redundant description and modify
wrongly used HTTP method in api-ref for v3 volume types.

Change-Id: I6f8911d9bc80f1c9d9889ebdf8e1bc2480df06d4

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I36b0f39d0323171639e595b86c19f6b9f2623cdb

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-27 08:42:36.000000000', 'message': "Include ARA in the ansible-previous venv

We are now using ARA for all the jobs, including the upgrades.
If ARA isn't installed, any playbook using the ansible-previous
venv would fail, because the callback plugin setup during the
first steps of the job is still in use.

Change-Id: Ibfb444aeacfecd3384314f0e9d92e096279c543a
"}]
commit_message:
Include ARA in the ansible-previous venv

We are now using ARA for all the jobs, including the upgrades.
If ARA isn't installed, any playbook using the ansible-previous
venv would fail, because the callback plugin setup during the
first steps of the job is still in use.

Change-Id: Ibfb444aeacfecd3384314f0e9d92e096279c543a

subject: doc: remove symlink for releasenotes
messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-27 20:53:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-28 11:02:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-27 20:53:39.000000000', 'message': "doc: remove symlink for releasenotes

Currently we have a symlink to releasenotes directory in doc/source,
but this confuses the infra translation script and as a result
Zanata (translation platform) has two 'releasenotes' resources
for neutron-fwaas-dashboard. We can use a direct URL in toctree,
so this commit changes the URL of releasenotes in the toctree
to avoid confusing the infra translation script.

It also simplifies the document index page. Previously we have
same strings for title and toctree. This is meaningless.
If we have more contents in future, let's revisit the structure
of the top page.

Change-Id: I9340577e9d1dc684fcd845a2fd2720eecac625f6
"}]
commit_message:
doc: remove symlink for releasenotes

Currently we have a symlink to releasenotes directory in doc/source,
but this confuses the infra translation script and as a result
Zanata (translation platform) has two 'releasenotes' resources
for neutron-fwaas-dashboard. We can use a direct URL in toctree,
so this commit changes the URL of releasenotes in the toctree
to avoid confusing the infra translation script.

It also simplifies the document index page. Previously we have
same strings for title and toctree. This is meaningless.
If we have more contents in future, let's revisit the structure
of the top page.

Change-Id: I9340577e9d1dc684fcd845a2fd2720eecac625f6

subject: Fix vagrant scripts to add IPv6 correctly
messages: [{'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2018-01-27 14:19:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2018-01-28 08:25:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23235, 'date': '2018-01-28 08:57:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-27 14:19:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix vagrant scripts to add IPv6 correctly

The script did not use the sudo command correctly, thus not really
enabling the IPv6 support.
Also, Moved the commands to the common script rather than having it
duplicated in all the scripts.

Change-Id: I66e84d76d905584635d42997f41eaef9d0263d3c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix vagrant scripts to add IPv6 correctly

The script did not use the sudo command correctly, thus not really
enabling the IPv6 support.
Also, Moved the commands to the common script rather than having it
duplicated in all the scripts.

Change-Id: I66e84d76d905584635d42997f41eaef9d0263d3c

and how it can intergrate with external DNS servers.

Related-bug: #1738195

commit_message:
Disable heat dashboard by default

The heat dashboard is now optional in horizon, so
we can enable it in the integrated build if we
have heat nodes.

Change-Id: Id6875b44ac5aba88d92d4765b7ee6dc961d0b595

commit_message:
Add heat dashboard to horizon

Heat is now a plugin that needs to be enabled in horizon [1].
This uses the same process as the other plugins.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/523402/

Change-Id: Ic3ec4684d941df6343074d9275fcfaeff6724181
Closes-Bug: 1745400

[{'created': '2018-01-02 16:54:53.000000000', 'message': 'Do not explicitly list thin provisioning tools for RPM

Ubuntu requires an additional package to be installed to enable thin
provisioning, but Red Hat based platforms have this included with the
base LVM2 package. An explicit item was added to bindep for the RPM
package that includes these thin tools, but that is not needed and
should be removed.

Change-Id: I7e7575746911e8d19a3804fa08b357c9563713f1
'}]
commit_message:
Do not explicitly list thin provisioning tools for RPM

Ubuntu requires an additional package to be installed to enable thin
provisioning, but Red Hat based platforms have this included with the
base LVM2 package. An explicit item was added to bindep for the RPM
package that includes these thin tools, but that is not needed and
should be removed.

Change-Id: I7e7575746911e8d19a3804fa08b357c9563713f1

commit_message:
OOB inspection support for `redfish` hardware type

This spec adds support for out-of-band inspection of Redfish
compliant servers using `redfish` hardware type. It fetches
node's essential properties and capabilities available on the
given hardware using DMTF standard Redfish resources.

Change-Id: I156e4610dc0e166c41c46b26fe23aedeb2f00129
Partial-bug: #1668487

commit_message:
V2/V3 json schema validation: snapshot manage

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below Snapshots API's
* POST /v2/{project_id}/os-snapshot-manage
* POST /v3/{project_id}/manageable_snapshots

Change-Id: I663005ec3c8f0b20c5ea25f6deca0502ac0a86f7
Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

The castellan user interface library recently
deprecated the 'api_class' configuration option
in favor of the 'backend' configuration option.

commit_message:
Update Signature Documentation

The castellan user interface library recently
deprecated the 'api_class' configuration option
in favor of the 'backend' configuration option.
This change updates the image signature
verification documentation to use the new
configuration option.

Change-Id: I0cc115eed1b7f271fe4bb7d0a385d487f2494d73

commit_message:
Add dmanchad and kforde as cloud admin

They will be working on the repurposing of the rh1 hardware and need
access to the bastion so they can inventory the nodes.

Change-Id: Ibefd26f1eda740819e7526e52bb35eda30f7a3f5

commit_message:
Send traits to ironic on server boot

When booting a server we currently only send capabilities from the
flavor extra specs. Given the move towards using traits, we should also
send the traits to ironic, so it knows what traits the user requested.

blueprint ironic-driver-traits

Change-Id: I50f59e609d225a80de93032ff82a8eedbe3ab485
Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>

[{'created': '2018-01-23 19:53:06.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "disable glance voting on py27 tests"

Previously, the glance py27 tox testenv ran both unit and functional tests.  Change I93d7216340bef70fc18fc9943da5c740ba3d4761 separates out the functional tests (which were causing the TIMED_OUT) from the unit tests.  Restore the cross-glance-py27 job to run the glance unit tests under py27.

See test patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536070/ to verify successful openstack-tox-py27 run.

This reverts commit 74223de1985d898395720d62060d757c41e6bfd8.

Change-Id: Icb13423f83a1cc096d287b3ae3e438e0d59a024a

commit_message:
Revert "disable glance voting on py27 tests"

Previously, the glance py27 tox testenv ran both unit and functional
tests.  Change I93d7216340bef70fc18fc9943da5c740ba3d4761 separates out
the functional tests (which were causing the TIMED_OUT) from the unit
tests.  Restore the cross-glance-py27 job to run the glance unit tests
under py27.

See test patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536070/ to verify
successful openstack-tox-py27 run.

This reverts commit 74223de1985d898395720d62060d757c41e6bfd8.

Change-Id: Icb13423f83a1cc096d287b3ae3e438e0d59a024a

commit_message:
Use shell instead of command module as using &> operator

This is required otherwise output of script is not redirected
to deploy_freeipa.log

messages: [{'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-01-28 06:59:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-01-28 07:12:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-28 06:59:52.000000000', 'message': 'Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I31e6655743d3f69a84046978fe40f76021823cf3
'}]
commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I31e6655743d3f69a84046978fe40f76021823cf3

[{'created': '2018-01-05 11:57:47.000000000', 'message': "Fix mock for eventlet.greenthread.sleep in Instorage tests

According to `Applying the same patch to every test method` section in
the [1] we shouldn't use mock decorators on setUp method. This patch fixes it
moving mocks into the setUp methods.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.5/library/unittest.mock-examples.html

Change-Id: I4c2097307f812eb5847367b58ef6ba65c23b3a26
"}, {'created': '2018-01-22 16:09:57.000000000', 'message': "Fix mock for sleep mocks in volume drivers tests

According to `Applying the same patch to every test method` section in
the [1] we shouldn't use mock decorators on setUp method. This patch fixes it
moving mocks into the setUp methods.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.5/library/unittest.mock-examples.html

Change-Id: I4c2097307f812eb5847367b58ef6ba65c23b3a26
"}, {'created': '2018-01-24 08:41:00.000000000', 'message': "[1/2] Fix mock for sleep mocks in volume drivers tests

According to `Applying the same patch to every test method` section in
the [1] we shouldn't use mock decorators on setUp method. This patch fixes it
moving mocks into the setUp methods.

This is the first patch in the series. We need to fix the sililar issue in IBM
drivers but this requires more work to fix them. So let's do fix this issue
step-by-step.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.5/library/unittest.mock-examples.html

Change-Id: I4c2097307f812eb5847367b58ef6ba65c23b3a26
"}]
commit_message:
[1/2] Fix mock for sleep mocks in volume drivers tests

According to `Applying the same patch to every test method` section in
the [1] we shouldn't use mock decorators on setUp method. This patch fixes it
moving mocks into the setUp methods.

This is the first patch in the series. We need to fix the sililar issue in IBM
drivers but this requires more work to fix them. So let's do fix this issue
step-by-step.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.5/library/unittest.mock-examples.html

Change-Id: I4c2097307f812eb5847367b58ef6ba65c23b3a26

subject: Add a notification driver for MQTT notifications
messages:
[{'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2017-12-21 00:11:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2017-12-21 04:08:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2017-12-22 02:31:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I think we need a oslo-spec for this, we also have other work items to do, like document and integration new driver in our CI test. So a spec can handle that and will be easy for users to understand the new driver.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-01-03 19:51:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

You might have already seen this - the team has crafted a policy document for creating new oslo.messaging drivers:

https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.messaging/latest/contributor/supported-messaging-drivers.html

These policies are in place to ensure that new drivers are of high quality and are actively maintained.  The "actively maintained" part is key as the existing maintainers may not have the level of familiarity with the driver's protocol to effectively maintain it.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2018-01-28 07:37:15.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I don't have the bandwidth to deal with any of that"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-21 00:11:40.000000000', 'message': "Add a notification driver for MQTT notifications

This commit adds a new notification driver, mqtt, for publishing

But, it's also very useful as a more generic event bus and provides a
lot of advantages for this. For example, MQTT is used by the OpenStack

services. [2]

for a notification bus, because it's able to scale quite well and also

commit_message:
Add a notification driver for MQTT notifications

This commit adds a new notification driver, mqtt, for publishing
notifications to an MQTT broker. MQTT is pub/sub protocol designed to
be lightweight and work in environments with unreliable networking. [1]
It's very widely used in IoT and embeded environments for these reasons.
But, it's also very useful as a more generic event bus and provides a
lot of advantages for this. For example, MQTT is used by the OpenStack
community infrastructure as a unified event bus between all the
services. [2]

For something like a large OpenStack deployment MQTT is a good choice
for a notification bus, because it's able to scale quite well and also
natively provides filtering support into the protocol to reduce load on
clients. The other advantage MQTT provides here is having client
bindings for a ton of different languages. [3] This enables people to
write tooling off notifications very easily in whatever tool is the
best fit.

[1] http://mqtt.org/
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/firehose.html
[3] https://github.com/mqtt/mqtt.github.io/wiki/libraries

Change-Id: I82cb256354165e0c5a853b1f71a87639e1165748

commit_message:
Add a precheck to ensure nscd is not running

The 'name service caching daemon (nscd)' seems to effectively disable
Docker's user namespace when '/run' is bind mounted. This can cause
issues with Kolla containers that use this mount, if the uid the
container runs as exists on the system, they clash and container will
either fail to start, have sudo issues, etc.

Change-Id: I9ac6bdb193f1520d025251d3abfa761700481cc9
Closes-Bug: #1723934

configuration parameters related to this feature. This patch fixes
the help messages for the same.

commit_message:
Update description for config params of 'rescue' interface

As ``rescue`` API implementation has merged, we can let users use
configuration parameters related to this feature. This patch fixes
the help messages for the same.

Change-Id: Idab95302011c3bb3f1db560a6a3f9481371e7671
Partial-bug: #1526449

commit_message:
Add rescue interface field to node-related notifications

This patch adds rescue_interface field to node-related notification
objects.

Co-Authored-By: Jay Faulkner <jay@jvf.cc>
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@pcsforeducation.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jesse J. Cook <jesse.j.cook@member.fsf.org>

Co-Authored-By: Aparna <aparnavtce@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Shivanand Tendulker <stendulker@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I8aa4c3c4701eae5f7838192bdbcf46a069370643
Partial-bug: #1526449

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-17 23:52:31.000000000', 'message': "autospec check: Allow 'wraps' to be an alternative to autospec

Don't cause an H210 error if the mock.patch/mock.patch.object call uses
the 'wraps' keyword. As that serves the same purpose in catching wrong
attributes.

In testing, if using 'autospec=True' with 'wraps', then the object
specified by 'wraps' does not get called.

Change-Id: I29a4df15c2511bd12655c09edcae8530cd5ce0d3
"}, {'created': '2017-11-12 22:59:11.000000000', 'message': "autospec check: Allow 'wraps' to be an alternative to autospec

Don't cause an H210 error if the mock.patch/mock.patch.object call uses
the 'wraps' keyword. As that serves the same purpose in catching wrong
attributes.

In testing, if using 'autospec=True' with 'wraps', then the object
specified by 'wraps' does not get called.

Change-Id: I29a4df15c2511bd12655c09edcae8530cd5ce0d3
"}]
commit_message:
autospec check: Allow 'wraps' to be an alternative to autospec

Don't cause an H210 error if the mock.patch/mock.patch.object call uses
the 'wraps' keyword. As that serves the same purpose in catching wrong
attributes.

In testing, if using 'autospec=True' with 'wraps', then the object
specified by 'wraps' does not get called.

Change-Id: I29a4df15c2511bd12655c09edcae8530cd5ce0d3

subject: Baremetal NIC list should return a list
messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-26 15:37:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-01-26 15:43:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-27 18:42:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-27 18:43:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-26 15:37:46.000000000', 'message': "Baremetal NIC list should return a list

Since the list_nics* methods were changed to use raw HTTP client rather
than the ironic client, they return a dict rather than a list. Instead
of getting this:

[{'address': '00:11:22:33:44:55', ...}, ...]

We get this:

{'ports': [{'address': '00:11:22:33:44:55', ...}, ...]}

This change removes this outer dict and returns to the old behaviour of
returning a list. This affects list_nics and list_nics_for_machine.

Change-Id: I3cb9ef5d97cf911cb4897b00ab4cef77b76efaa4
"}, {'created': '2018-01-27 18:42:29.000000000', 'message': "Baremetal NIC list should return a list

Since the list_nics* methods were changed to use raw HTTP client rather
than the ironic client, they return a dict rather than a list. Instead
of getting this:

[{'address': '00:11:22:33:44:55', ...}, ...]

We get this:

{'ports': [{'address': '00:11:22:33:44:55', ...}, ...]}

This change removes this outer dict and returns to the old behaviour of
returning a list. This affects list_nics and list_nics_for_machine.

Change-Id: I3cb9ef5d97cf911cb4897b00ab4cef77b76efaa4
"}]
commit_message:
Baremetal NIC list should return a list

Since the list_nics* methods were changed to use raw HTTP client rather
than the ironic client, they return a dict rather than a list. Instead
of getting this:

[{'address': '00:11:22:33:44:55', ...}, ...]

We get this:

{'ports': [{'address': '00:11:22:33:44:55', ...}, ...]}

This change removes this outer dict and returns to the old behaviour of
returning a list. This affects list_nics and list_nics_for_machine.

Change-Id: I3cb9ef5d97cf911cb4897b00ab4cef77b76efaa4

commit_message:
Support configurable admin credentials in Postgres

- Use endpoints auth section
- Store user and password in secrets
- Set them in the statefulset Pod environment

Change-Id: I9e503243f6ca157c4257475e902aa8138d2b089e

commit_message:
start_flag = True, only first time, or conf change

Set up in memory tracking of previously reported nodes
and the bridge_mapping configuration. If the node was
already reported with this configuration, don't set the
report_state start_flag. We only want to set the
start_flag when reporting a new node, or if the baremetal
ports associated with the node was updated.

This reduces the work neutron side, since it will only
have to calculate and set/update segment_host_mapping
when there is an actual change.

Related-Bug: #1658964
Change-Id: I6860483c957988843416b2d913deb97fbb18c391

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-17 09:03:07.000000000', 'message': '[Unity] Add `force detach` support

Add support to force detach a volume from all hosts on Unity.

Closes-bug: #1741831
Change-Id: I5f0f3d474b00f3c1f742c1bfa6877911415c32f9
'}]
commit_message:
[Unity] Add `force detach` support

Add support to force detach a volume from all hosts on Unity.

Closes-bug: #1741831
Change-Id: I5f0f3d474b00f3c1f742c1bfa6877911415c32f9

subject: Zuul: Remove project name
messages: [{'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-01-27 18:36:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-01-27 23:28:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-27 18:36:05.000000000', 'message': 'Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Id414b93720850850f6b856a59075b653e427e67d
'}]
commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Id414b93720850850f6b856a59075b653e427e67d

commit_message:
use extlinks to build series-specific links

Use the extlinks extension to build links to docs in other projects so
the links update automatically when branches are created.

Change-Id: Ie11ea7cee589eb881fcbcc8831680d06b0b10689
Depends-On: Ia46560665372748b1e303093c76a87af3b6938e5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
use intersphinx to link to horizon

This is a demo patch showing how to use intersphinx to link to another
project in a way that is updated automatically when a stable branch is
created.

Needs a change in openstackdocstheme to add the function and a change
in horizon to add the target used in the example.

Change-Id: Icf2ce59680ec98e1eb511ce4de9befbc73f6c15e
Depends-On: I9c76770516d43e7cc67706d3dc4e0efa79768e01
Depends-On: I1a2d48da1377ca4da3c341b66f9202101a7e1111
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
log test: use fixtures.StandardLogging in setUp

We already had fixtures.StandardLogging for log test.
Use this class in setUP, to save some duplicate
codes.

Change-Id: I565eea30a870f9d69f7bc75f35e55515fac6c99e
Signed-off-by: Chen Hanxiao <chenhx@certusnet.com.cn>

[{'created': '2017-07-13 23:56:26.000000000', 'message': 'Remove deprecated command from lenovo driver.

A future firmware release will remove a deprecated API command.
With this change, the driver will use the new alternative command
instead, while support is retained for older hardware that does
not support the new command.

Change-Id: I981639cebd054fa758efa565a9a32d71a311a1a9
'}, {'created': '2017-07-20 22:02:07.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid use of deprecated command from lenovo driver.

commit_message:
Avoid use of deprecated commands in lenovo driver

Recent firmware updates contain minor syntax changes.  This change
updates the driver to use the correct syntax based on the firmware
version or whether the backend is 'linear' or 'virtual'.

Change-Id: I981639cebd054fa758efa565a9a32d71a311a1a9

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 23:26:11.000000000', 'message': 'Track tree-associated providers in report client

With this change, SchedulerReportClient._ensure_resource_provider
expands its scope to pull down and cache all providers in the nested
tree associated with the specified UUID.  For each such provider, we
continue to track and refresh its traits, aggregates, and any providers
associated via aggregate.

This change set represents the last piece of data we need to have pulled
in from placement before we can pass the replete ProviderTree to
ComputeDriver.update_provider_tree.

Change-Id: I0b4d04a17e5e84b586a884143c5ee7ccea1c17bb

commit_message:
Track tree-associated providers in report client

With this change, SchedulerReportClient._ensure_resource_provider
expands its scope to pull down and cache all providers in the nested
tree associated with the specified UUID.  For each such provider, we
continue to track and refresh its traits, aggregates, and any providers
associated via aggregate.

This change set represents the last piece of data we need to have pulled
in from placement before we can pass the replete ProviderTree to
ComputeDriver.update_provider_tree.

Change-Id: I0b4d04a17e5e84b586a884143c5ee7ccea1c17bb
blueprint: nested-resource-providers

commit_message:
Add log-tag to haproxy config file

By adding a log-tag line to the haproxy config file that contains
the network or router id, we will be able to differentiate which
proxy is logging what.  This should help with debugging.

Change-Id: I5bb57b7682c00645e20cce69847dbb3b72165aa8
Partial-bug: #1744359
(cherry picked from commit 703ff85b8262997f209e7666396c5d430d3baa34)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 19:54:07.000000000', 'message': "Report Client: PUT empty (not None) JSON data

Previously if a False-ish payload was sent to SchedulerReportClient.put,
we wouldn't send it through in the API call at all.  But False-ish
payloads may be legitimate: e.g. there is currently no DELETE API for
/resource_providers/{u}/aggregates so this is how you would remove all
aggregate associations for a provider.

In any case, placement's PUT API refuses to accept a request that
doesn't have Content-Type: application/json, which is set automatically
by Session if json is not None.

With this change set, we send payloads through to PUT unless they're
actually None.

Change-Id: I69d2b16d515590907ca0e0dc4da77dcf8e539976
Closes-Bug: #1744786
"}]
commit_message:
Report Client: PUT empty (not None) JSON data

Previously if a False-ish payload was sent to SchedulerReportClient.put,
we wouldn't send it through in the API call at all.  But False-ish
payloads may be legitimate: e.g. there is currently no DELETE API for
/resource_providers/{u}/aggregates so this is how you would remove all
aggregate associations for a provider.

In any case, placement's PUT API refuses to accept a request that
doesn't have Content-Type: application/json, which is set automatically
by Session if json is not None.

With this change set, we send payloads through to PUT unless they're
actually None.

Change-Id: I69d2b16d515590907ca0e0dc4da77dcf8e539976
Closes-Bug: #1744786

commit_message:
tools: Simplify grep_all.sh

Branches and tags are really just refs in git so rather than
open-codeing that and having 2 for loops just call everything a ref.

While we're there sort tags in reverse order this has the cosmetic
advantage that series are chronological order ie:

    1.1.0-1215-g8dc48120  : openstackdocstheme===1.18.1
    origin/master         : openstackdocstheme===1.18.1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-26 10:47:52.000000000', 'message': 'Ironic: Get IP address for volume connector

When storage network is managed by Neutron, an IP address for volume
connector cannot be registered by an operator in advance. A MAC
address can be registered as a volume connector for an Ironic node.

This patch gets an IP address for volume connector based on a MAC
address. To bind VIFs to Ironic ports before connecting a volume,
VIFs are attached earlier with a new virt driver API. Nova can get
an IP address assigned to a NIC by seeing MAC addresses of Ironic
resources and VIFs.

Implements: blueprint ironic-boot-from-volume
Change-Id: I999bbfc0e28ec43390298deb59e2b6f6e10bf8ea
'}, {'created': '2017-06-06 10:48:04.000000000', 'message': 'Ironic: Get IP address for volume connector

'}, {'created': '2017-07-24 12:22:07.000000000', 'message': 'Ironic: Get IP address for volume connector

When storage network is managed by neutron, an IP address for volume
connector cannot be registered by an operator in advance. A MAC
address can be registered as a volume connector for an Ironic node.
The IP address may be required depending on cinder backend drivers.

This patch gets an IP address for a volume connector based on a MAC
address assigned to a volume connector in ironic. To bind VIFs to
ironic ports before connecting a volume, VIFs are attached earlier
with a new virt driver API. Nova can get an IP address assigned to
a VIF attached to a ironic port by retrieving the port with the

commit_message:
Ironic: Get IP address for volume connector

When storage network for booting an instance from iSCSI volume is
managed by neutron, an IP address for volume connector cannot be
registered by an operator in advance. A MAC address can be registered
as a volume connector for an Ironic node. The IP address may be
required depending on cinder backend drivers.

This patch gets an IP address for a volume connector based on a MAC
address assigned to a volume connector in ironic. To bind VIFs to
ironic ports before connecting a volume, VIFs are attached earlier
with a new virt driver API. Nova can get an IP address assigned to
a VIF attached to an ironic port by retrieving the port with the
MAC address.

Co-Authored-By: Satoru Moriya <satoru.moriya.br@hitachi.com>
Implements: blueprint ironic-volume-connector-ip
Change-Id: I999bbfc0e28ec43390298deb59e2b6f6e10bf8ea

commit_message:
Throw OpenStackCloudCreateException on create errors

The exception is OpenStackCloudCreateException, not
OpenStackCloudCreationException.

Change-Id: Ia1bad2e279ed472d93c818d07a1d6de8723ab151

commit_message:

commit_message:
zun: delete container by using 'stop' option

This option will stop the container first before deleting the
container. Unlike the old 'force' option, this option doesn't
require admin privilege thus enabling non-admin users to delete
the container. Using 'stop' option requires a newer api_version so
we add support for setting api_version as well.

Change-Id: I34a0331afd7452e193c166838e8ca8b2dc268fb1

commit_message:
Ensure libguestfs_kernel_override kernel is installed

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/535293/ assumed
that centos7 base kernel 3.10.0-693.el7.x86_64 is
always installed in the centos 7.4 vm. But it's not true for
some images which are build using DIB(ex: centos7-minimal).
This patch ensures libguestfs_kernel_override kernel
is installed before running virt-customize command.

Change-Id: Ic41b0675153c590ad7daf79a3bc117156f2173f3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-26 15:37:46.000000000', 'message': "Pass through all_projects for get_server

This function currently does not allow getting of a server
from all projects, and it can be quite useful to do so (for
various admin/operator activities) so allow get_server to
pass through 'all_projects' to the internally called
'search_servers' (and default it to false to retain the old
behavior).

Change-Id: I7b7534a044cfa0ccbaa11a635edcca388db27f0f
"}]
commit_message:
Pass through all_projects for get_server

This function currently does not allow getting of a server
from all projects, and it can be quite useful to do so (for
various admin/operator activities) so allow get_server to
pass through 'all_projects' to the internally called
'search_servers' (and default it to false to retain the old
behavior).

Change-Id: I7b7534a044cfa0ccbaa11a635edcca388db27f0f

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I3cc987809ca4aae4e1a1737035f1ef73149877e0

messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-26 15:37:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-27 18:33:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-26 15:37:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix batching for floating ips and ports

When cache settings are in place for ports and floating ips, we should
be doing full list calls and filtering locally. This is done to prevent
things lke nodepool from crushing clouds under the weight of our immense
need for information.

Change-Id: I304ff1c0e355bcfc00398316a296417c19e9b74f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix batching for floating ips and ports

When cache settings are in place for ports and floating ips, we should
be doing full list calls and filtering locally. This is done to prevent
things lke nodepool from crushing clouds under the weight of our immense
need for information.

Change-Id: I304ff1c0e355bcfc00398316a296417c19e9b74f

commit_message:
Add innodb rules for mysql validation template

Add some nodb configuration options on valuation rules file,
these options are availables from the release 5.6 and 5.7

https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/innodb-parameters.html
https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/innodb-parameters.html

Closes-bug: #1745477
Change-Id: I2636f4fae06e50be9cfee1a344b3d1f094b2173d

commit_message:
bump requirements for neutron-lib to 1.13.0

This patch changes the neutron-lib global requirement to pickup
I0e710ed79b9d774e9aaaea4220b0d39becaf4343 which is required for the
Queens release.

Change-Id: I85194cae6b6c192a1a01606b0db292a44dc77852

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-19 15:10:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fix _port_arg for security rules with icmp/ipv6-icmp aliases

When a security group rule is created with icmp/ipv6-icmp alias such as
protocol number 1(ICMP), 58(ICMPv6) or string icmpv6(legacy name for
ipv6-icmp) as its protocol along with ICMP/ICMPv6 message type
specified, _port_arg will generate a wrong str for iptables/ip6tables.

Change-Id: Iae01b9a0da34797a5f061a110f06e18be9bbec5a
Closes-Bug: #1743552
(cherry picked from commit 0efe1aec185365d8bd7a14ec5b812132d0f9e44d)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix _port_arg for security rules with icmp/ipv6-icmp aliases

When a security group rule is created with icmp/ipv6-icmp alias such as
protocol number 1(ICMP), 58(ICMPv6) or string icmpv6(legacy name for
ipv6-icmp) as its protocol along with ICMP/ICMPv6 message type
specified, _port_arg will generate a wrong str for iptables/ip6tables.

Change-Id: Iae01b9a0da34797a5f061a110f06e18be9bbec5a
Closes-Bug: #1743552
(cherry picked from commit 0efe1aec185365d8bd7a14ec5b812132d0f9e44d)

commit_message:
Restore functional test jobs

These were disabled in I55e204b72cd5a2876576852b10ad09f24d04beb4 to
reduce the gate failure rate while we eliminated duplicate tests in heat
and heat-tempest-plugin.

Change-Id: Ifd2aececfa5b1b0f2c8959ad500d4d3197427d19

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-13 15:14:54.000000000', 'message': "VMAX driver - Incorrect stats reporting

There is an issue in the way free_capacity_gb is being calculated for
the VMAX driver - it is using 'total_allocated_capacity' instead of
calculating using 'total_used_cap', or taking 'fba_free_capacity'. There
is also excess queries being made (and logs being produced), as the
capacities are being requested for each pool. This is unnecessary since
WLP support was removed - the capacities are reported at an SRP level
and so will be the same for each service level/ workload combination.
This patch rectifies these issues.

Change-Id: Icdafd47865e3cf1e5b687f39f15b8ebfccbf67a3
Closes-Bug: 1731930

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Incorrect stats reporting

There is an issue in the way free_capacity_gb is being calculated for
the VMAX driver - it is using 'total_allocated_capacity' instead of
calculating using 'total_used_cap', or taking 'fba_free_capacity'. There
is also excess queries being made (and logs being produced), as the
capacities are being requested for each pool. This is unnecessary since
WLP support was removed - the capacities are reported at an SRP level
and so will be the same for each service level/ workload combination.
This patch rectifies these issues.

Change-Id: Icdafd47865e3cf1e5b687f39f15b8ebfccbf67a3
Closes-Bug: 1731930

[{'created': '2018-01-17 20:19:22.000000000', 'message': "Do not validate root partition size for whole disk images in iscsi deploy

On whole disk images a root partition is already created and populated, so
validating its size makes no sense. We don't do it for direct deploy.

Change-Id: I7a4114979afb310aeb77f99fbcf09ef7c54862d6
Closes-Bug: #1742451
(cherry picked from commit a7623d92dc4d7c7bcc436656b93c8fe963e79bfd)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not validate root partition size for whole disk images in iscsi deploy

On whole disk images a root partition is already created and populated, so
validating its size makes no sense. We don't do it for direct deploy.

Change-Id: I7a4114979afb310aeb77f99fbcf09ef7c54862d6
Closes-Bug: #1742451
(cherry picked from commit a7623d92dc4d7c7bcc436656b93c8fe963e79bfd)

Remove ReloadOnSighupTest

Most jobs now run with apache+uwsgi, so the test has no significance.
Also we don't test it anymore.

commit_message:
Add scope_types to service policies

Services in keystone are entities that are specific to the deployment
system. It makes sense that you'd need a system-scoped token in order
to manage services.

This commit adds `system` as the scope type for services. Now when
project scoped tokens are used to manage services, a warning will
be logged. Operators will also have the ability to turn on the
`enforce_scope` option via oslo.policy to require system-scoped
tokens to interact with services.

Change-Id: If3bd1dd5680e397da16a493d32326207ada05404

[{'created': '2018-01-19 15:10:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix _port_arg for security rules with icmp/ipv6-icmp aliases

When a security group rule is created with icmp/ipv6-icmp alias such as
protocol number 1(ICMP), 58(ICMPv6) or string icmpv6(legacy name for
ipv6-icmp) as its protocol along with ICMP/ICMPv6 message type
specified, _port_arg will generate a wrong str for iptables/ip6tables.

Change-Id: Iae01b9a0da34797a5f061a110f06e18be9bbec5a
Closes-Bug: #1743552
(cherry picked from commit 0efe1aec185365d8bd7a14ec5b812132d0f9e44d)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix _port_arg for security rules with icmp/ipv6-icmp aliases

When a security group rule is created with icmp/ipv6-icmp alias such as
protocol number 1(ICMP), 58(ICMPv6) or string icmpv6(legacy name for
ipv6-icmp) as its protocol along with ICMP/ICMPv6 message type
specified, _port_arg will generate a wrong str for iptables/ip6tables.

Change-Id: Iae01b9a0da34797a5f061a110f06e18be9bbec5a
Closes-Bug: #1743552
(cherry picked from commit 0efe1aec185365d8bd7a14ec5b812132d0f9e44d)
